p: According to the United Nations [ 1], the global population is expected to increase from 7.7 billion (2019) to 9.7 billion in 2050. This prospect raises several concerns about the global consumption of biomass, fossil fuels, metals, and minerals, which should double [ 2], and annual waste production, following the current trend, will increase by 70% in the next 40 years [ 3]. Undoubtedly, these premises challenge the move toward a more sustainable development.
